DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Separate Internal Mammary Lymph Node Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to separated field of lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum for radiation therapy being administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Separate Internal Mammary Lymph Node Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to separated field of lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum for radiation therapy being administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredName: Separate Internal Mammary Lymph Node Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Independent; not united or joint.:Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes of the breast located under the ribcage, near the sternum.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
